title: Version 33 production branding deployment verification (Dini GC title + favicon)

requirements.summary: Ensure Version 33 ships with the intended branding in production by verifying the HTML document title and the referenced favicon/apple-touch-icon asset paths exist and are correct.
acceptanceCriteria: A production deployment succeeds without a generic "Deployment error".
On the production site, the browser tab title is "Dini GC".
On the production site, the favicon appears and is loaded from the path referenced in frontend/index.html (/assets/generated/dinigc-favicon.dim_64x64.png).
On the production site, the apple touch icon is referenced as /assets/generated/dinigc-apple-touch-icon.dim_180x180.png.

file_operations.description: Confirm the HTML <title> remains exactly "Dini GC" and that the favicon and apple-touch-icon <link> tags reference the exact production paths /assets/generated/dinigc-favicon.dim_64x64.png and /assets/generated/dinigc-apple-touch-icon.dim_180x180.png (no behavioral/UI changes beyond ensuring these exact references).
Verify the favicon asset is present at this exact path in the frontend static assets so it is included in the production build output.
Verify the apple touch icon asset is present at this exact path in the frontend static assets so it is included in the production build output.

Add a small pre-deploy verification script that checks (a) frontend/index.html contains title "Dini GC" and the exact icon hrefs, and (b) the referenced static asset files exist in frontend/public/assets/generated/; keep this as a deployment guardrail and do not change any runtime UI behavior.

Document a minimal deployment checklist for Version 33 branding verification (title + favicon + apple-touch-icon paths) to help ensure the production deployment ships the intended assets without introducing product/UI changes.
